headline: DNA from West Africa Adds to Picture of Humansâ€™ Rise
abstract: From a burial site in Cameroon, archaeologists recovered human genetic material dating as far back as 8,000 years.
lead_paragraph: In October 2015, scientists reconstructed the genome of a 4,500-year-old man who lived in Ethiopia. It was the first time that anyone had created a complete genetic snapshot of an African from an ancient skeleton.
